title: Sampler, 1835
medium:
Medium: silk embroidery on linen foundation
Technique: embroidered on plain weave foundation
provenance: Ex. coll. Fraser/Martin. Written on back of frame: Fraser, bought at Colony Shops, Madison Avenue, NYC, 1923.
creditline: Gift of Anonymous Donor from the Fraser/Martin Collection
description:
A large tomb surmounted by an urn in the center, with the inscription To the memory of my beloved Father. With a tree and a verse on each side, and surrounded by a grape vine border. 
The verses read: 

This languishing head is at rest
Its thinking and aching are o'er
This quiet immovable breast
Is heav'd by affliction no more

This heart is no longer the seal
Of trouble and torturing pain
It ceases to flutter and beat
It never shall flutter again

tombstone.epitaph:
Sampler, 1835.
1835. Medium: silk embroidery on linen foundation
Technique: embroidered on plain weave foundation. Gift of Anonymous Donor from the Fraser/Martin Collection. 1974-100-11.
